subject: RE: [Read_Alphabet] if symbols that are 180 degree similar are confusing then shouldn't Quickscript/
msgSnippet: Hello All, I ve been lexdysexic....oops or is that dyslexic, for years.  I do not have any problems with the reversing of characters in reading or writing
messageBody:
Hello All,
 
I've been lexdysexic....oops or is that dyslexic, for years.  I do not have any problems with the reversing of characters in reading or writing them. What I do have a problem with is transposing several letters or groups of letters. I've been writing in Quickscript for about 5 years. I use it in my everyday and over all I find less dyslexic problems with it.
 
The characters for Tea and Pet do not look at all like each other, nor to the characters for Bay & Tie.
 
Chuck
 
P.S. Northern New Jersey or Rockland County New York, depending on the day of the week. QS user for about 5 years.

From: robert McBroom [mailto:mcbroom1946@...]
Sent: Friday, August 13, 2004 3:43 PM
To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] if symbols that are 180 degree similar are confusing then shouldn't Quickscript/

--- satnordameriko <satnordameriko@...> wrote:

> Read create new symbols. From my understand the
>
problems with
> symbols that are similar is a big problem for
>
dyslexics and/or for
> folks trying to learn a new writing
system.
>
>
From what I know about dyslexia, it is the switching
of symbols ("pr" to "rp") more than seeing them
backwards.

It is also known that other languages, where letters
actually represent unique sounds, do not produce the
extreme number of dyslexics that dear old English
does. So there!

As to the characters just being confusing, I find
that, like anything, practice will help, and also
tweaking the symbols to be more "graphic" and bold in
their distinctions can overcome many difficulties.
(See my font to come.)

PS: I'm in upstate NY near Woodstock, and have been
QS'ing for about 5 years now. Welcome aboard.

=====
Bob McBroom Woodstock NY"Begin the morning by saying to yourself, I shall meet with the busybody, the ungrateful, arrogant, deceitful, envious, unsocial. All these things happened to them by reason of their ignorance of what is good and evil. But I  have seen the nature of the good, that it is beautiful, and of the bad, that it is ugly, and the nature of him who does wrong, that it is akin to mine, and participates in the same intelligence, and holds the same portion of divinity."- Marcus Aureliius

Hello All,
 
I've been lexdysexic....oops or is that dyslexic, for years.  I do not have
any problems with the reversing of characters in reading or writing them.
What I do have a problem with is transposing several letters or groups of
letters. I've been writing in Quickscript for about 5 years. I use it in my
everyday and over all I find less dyslexic problems with it.
 
The characters for Tea and Pet do not look at all like each other, nor to
the characters for Bay & Tie.
 
Chuck
 
P.S. Northern New Jersey or Rockland County New York, depending on the day
of the week. QS user for about 5 years.

  _____

--- satnordameriko <satnordameriko@...> wrote:

> Read create new symbols. From my understand the
> problems with 
> symbols that are similar is a big problem for
> dyslexics and/or for 
> folks trying to learn a new writing system.
> 
>
From what I know about dyslexia, it is the switching
of symbols ("pr" to "rp") more than seeing them
backwards.

It is also known that other languages, where letters
actually represent unique sounds, do not produce the
extreme number of dyslexics that dear old English
does. So there!

As to the characters just being confusing, I find
that, like anything, practice will help, and also
tweaking the symbols to be more "graphic" and bold in
their distinctions can overcome many difficulties.
(See my font to come.)

PS: I'm in upstate NY near Woodstock, and have been
QS'ing for about 5 years now. Welcome aboard.

=====
Bob McBroom Woodstock NY"Begin the morning by saying to yourself, I shall
meet with the busybody, the ungrateful, arrogant, deceitful, envious,
unsocial. All these things happened to them by reason of their ignorance of
what is good and evil. But I  have seen the nature of the good, that it is
beautiful, and of the bad, that it is ugly, and the nature of him who does
wrong, that it is akin to mine, and participates in the same intelligence,
and holds the same portion of divinity."- Marcus Aureliius


--Boundary_(ID_IO6OvJXBtTMx+LIwUtdHiQ)
